thread.title: Saudi Arabia shares lower at close of trade; Tadawul All Share down 1.22% By Investing.com
thread.title_full: Saudi Arabia shares lower at close of trade; Tadawul All Share down 1.22% By Investing.com

author: Investing.com
title: Saudi Arabia shares lower at close of trade; Tadawul All Share down 1.22% By Investing.com
text:
Investing.com â€“ Saudi Arabia equities were lower at the close on Tuesday, as losses in the Insurance , Agriculture & Food and Industrial Investment sectors propelled shares lower.
At the close in Saudi Arabia, the Tadawul All Share declined 1.22%.
The biggest gainers of the session on the Tadawul All Share were Savola Group (TADAWUL: 2050 ), which rose 9.89% or 2.75 points to trade at 30.55 at the close. Arriyadh Development Co. (TADAWUL: 4150 ) added 3.92% or 1.15 points to end at 30.50 and Bawan (TADAWUL: 1302 ) was up 3.84% or 2.00 points to 54.10 in late trade.
Biggest losers included Almarai Company (TADAWUL: 2280 ), which lost 4.27% or 2.60 points to trade at 58.30 in late trade. Jahez International Company for Information Systems Technology SCJSC (TADAWUL: 6017 ) declined 4.23% or 1.35 points to end at 30.55 and United Int Transportation Company (TADAWUL: 4260 ) shed 3.71% or 2.90 points to 75.20.
Declining stocks outnumbered rising ones by 243 to 75 and 18 ended unchanged on the Saudi Arabia Stock Exchange.
In commodities trading, Crude oil for January delivery was down 1.64% or 1.16 to $69.55 a barrel. Meanwhile, Brent oil for delivery in February fell 0.97% or 0.72 to hit $73.19 a barrel, while the February Gold Futures contract fell 0.46% or 12.39 to trade at $2,657.61 a troy ounce.
EUR/SAR was down 0.17% to 3.94, while USD/SAR unchanged 0.00% to 3.76.
The US Dollar Index Futures was up 0.11% at 106.67.
